https://prez.dev/description.@value: Methods used to spatially locate geological features and exploration, mining and related infrastructure sites. These can be either features directly observed in the field (e.g. site/outcrop descriptions, structural readings, etc.) or obtained from legacy and current documents/datasets (e.g. airphotos, maps, previously published reports, exploration reports, etc.). Each location method has a spatial accuracy that indicates an estimate of the approximate error in the location. Captured geographical locations for geological or mining features are expressed as a set of coordinates (latitude and longitude degrees), with or without an elevation above or below sea level.

Geographical location of points marked on hardcopy airphotos (or images thereof) determined by visual comparison with georeferenced imagery acquired by the Advanced Land Observing Satellite (ALOS; https://earth.esa.int/eogateway/missions/alos). Captured as Map Grid of Australia (MGA) 1994 coordinates. Accuracy is typically within 25 m.

https://prez.dev/label.@value: capture from airphoto using Landsat TM (MGA)

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Geographical location of points marked on hardcopy airphotos (or images thereof) determined by determined visual comparison with georeferenced imagery acquired by NASA's Landsat Thematic Mapper (TM ) satellites. Captured as Map Grid of Australia (MGA) 1994 coordinates. Accuracy is typically within 25 m.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: Geographical location of points marked on hardcopy airphotos (or images thereof) determined by visual comparison with georeferenced imagery. Captured as Map Grid of Australia (MGA) 1994 coordinates. Accuracy varies from 5 to 100 m.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Used by GSWA to capture locations of geological observations or exploration/mining/infrastructure sites.

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Geographical location of points marked on hardcopy airphotos (or images thereof) determined by visual comparison with georeferenced imagery. Captured as Map Grid of Australia (MGA) 1994 coordinates. Accuracy varies from 5 to 100 m.

Geographical location of points marked on hardcopy airphotos (or images thereof) determined by visual comparison with georeferenced orthophotographs, i.e. aerial photos taken with a high resolution camera that have been geometrically corrected to give a uniform scale. Captured as Map Grid of Australia (MGA) 1994 coordinates. Accuracy depends on the scale of the airphoto and ranges between 25 m and 100 m.

https://prez.dev/label.@value: capture from airphoto using SPOT P (MGA)

https://prez.dev/description.@value: Geographical location of points marked on hardcopy airphotos (or images thereof) determined by visual comparison with georeferenced imagery acquired by Satellite Pour l'Observation de la Terre (SPOT P), a commercial satellite imaging system which uses a Panchromatic sensor to capture highly detailed black and white images. Captured as Map Grid of Australia (MGA) 1994 coordinates. Accuracy is typically 25 m.

Geographical location of points marked on the back of hardcopy airphotos (or images thereof) determined by: 1) scanning and rectifying position marks on the back of the airphoto; 2) scanning and rectifying the front of the airphoto; 3) overlaying a mirror image of the rectified scan of the back of the airphoto onto the rectified scan of the front. Captured as Map Grid of Australia (MGA) 1994 coordinates. Accuracy depends on the scale of the airphoto and ranges between 25 m and 100 m.
